Comment: Overflow Room for additional public viewing at 250 Broadway.

Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by Imam Mamadou Saliou Bah, spiritual leader at Futa Islamic Center, located at 3400 Third Avenue, Bronx, NY 10456.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gibson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Imam Mamadou Saliou Bah, spiritual leader at Futa Islamic Center, located at 3400 Third Avenue, Bronx, NY 10456.

Council Member Gibson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Speaker (Council Member Johnson)
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b and 11.20c of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application Number C 210202 ZSM (The Windmere) shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, The Windmere, Manhattan (C 210202 ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Members Reynoso
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Application No. C 210329 PCK (101 Varick Avenue) shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.MinutesNote: The Assistant Majority Leader (Council Member Cornegy) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Assistant Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cornegy).

At the time of this Stated Meeting, there were 2 vacancies in the Council (22nd District, Queens and 48th District, Brooklyn) pending the swearing-in of the respective certified winners of the November 2, 2021 General Election.
